instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message: i made a post about this before, in that case i solved it by replacing trackpad, io board...but now ive got two of these with the same issue. i replace trackpad and io board, and they are still shutting down ramdomly. i dont have any idea where to check, since its such a weird issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message:
Test the board alone, without TP/KB, nor RIO flex, or other device connected.
Use an USB device to confirm activity.

All the voltages come on, including VCORE?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Any history available?
